analysisPopulations.name: Screened Set
analysisPopulations.label: SSCR
analysisPopulations.description: All participants who signed informed consent and underwent any screening assessments
analysisPopulations.criteria: All participants who provided informed consent and had any screening procedure performed

analysisPopulations.name: Enrolled Set
analysisPopulations.label: ENR
analysisPopulations.description: All participants who were enrolled into the study (typically on Day -7) according to the protocol
analysisPopulations.criteria: All participants who met eligibility criteria and were formally enrolled in the study

analysisPopulations.name: Full Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: FAS
analysisPopulations.description: Primary efficacy analysis population, generally aligned with the ICH E9 intent‑to‑treat principle
analysisPopulations.criteria: All enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840 and have sufficient intake/output data to contribute to copper/molybdenum balance assessments

analysisPopulations.name: Per Protocol Set
analysisPopulations.label: PP
analysisPopulations.description: Subset of the Full Analysis Set without major protocol deviations that could affect primary efficacy evaluation; used for sensitivity analyses when the PP Set has at least 3 participants
analysisPopulations.criteria: Participants in the Full Analysis Set who have no major protocol deviations judged to impact the assessment of copper/molybdenum balance, and who complete required baseline and on‑treatment collection periods

analysisPopulations.name: Safety Set
analysisPopulations.label: SAF
analysisPopulations.description: Population used for all safety analyses including adverse events, laboratory tests, vital signs, ECGs, and exposure
analysisPopulations.criteria: All participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: PKAS
analysisPopulations.description: Population used for PK concentration and parameter analyses of ALXN1840 and molybdenum
analysisPopulations.criteria: All participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840 and have at least one evaluable PK sample (e.g. on Days 1, 25, 29, or 39) without significant PK-related protocol deviations

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacodynamic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: PDAS
analysisPopulations.description: Population used for PD analyses related to copper disposition and PD biomarkers (e.g., plasma copper measures)
analysisPopulations.criteria: All participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840 and have at least one evaluable PD measurement as per protocol (e.g. during intake/output collection periods) and no major PD-related protocol deviations

characteristics.name: Age
characteristics.description: Age in years at reference date (typically date of informed consent or first dose, per SAP Appendix 9.2.2 on age and dates)

characteristics.name: Sex
characteristics.description: Sex of participant as recorded on CRF (e.g. male, female)

characteristics.name: Race
characteristics.description: Race as collected on demographics CRF (e.g. White, Black or African American, Asian, etc.)

characteristics.name: Ethnicity
characteristics.description: Ethnicity as collected on demographics CRF (e.g. Hispanic or Latino, Not Hispanic or Latino)

characteristics.name: Body Mass Index
characteristics.description: Body mass index calculated from height and weight at baseline, per SAP Appendix 9.2.5

characteristics.name: Baseline Disease Characteristics – Wilson Disease History
characteristics.description: Wilson Disease (WD) history including age at diagnosis, disease duration, clinical presentation, and relevant disease status at baseline, as summarized in Section 7.1.3.2 and 7.1.3.3

characteristics.name: Baseline Copper Balance
characteristics.description: Mean daily copper balance during pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1), measured as intake (food and drink) minus output (feces and urine)

characteristics.name: Baseline Molybdenum Balance
characteristics.description: Mean daily molybdenum balance during pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1), analogous to copper balance

characteristics.name: Baseline Copper Intake
characteristics.description: Total daily copper intake from food, drink, and study drug during the baseline collection period (Days -4 through -1)

characteristics.name: Baseline Copper Output – Urine
characteristics.description: Daily urinary copper excretion during the pretreatment baseline period

characteristics.name: Baseline Copper Output – Feces
characteristics.description: Daily fecal copper excretion during the pretreatment baseline period

characteristics.name: Baseline Molybdenum Intake
characteristics.description: Total daily molybdenum intake from food, drink, and study drug during the baseline collection period

characteristics.name: Baseline Molybdenum Output – Urine
characteristics.description: Daily urinary molybdenum excretion during the pretreatment baseline period

characteristics.name: Baseline Molybdenum Output – Feces
characteristics.description: Daily fecal molybdenum excretion during the pretreatment baseline period

characteristics.name: Baseline Plasma Copper Measures
characteristics.description: Baseline plasma copper-related measures such as total copper and labile bound copper (LBC), as part of disease characteristics/PD profile

characteristics.name: Baseline Plasma Molybdenum
characteristics.description: Baseline plasma total molybdenum concentration

characteristics.name: Medical and Surgical History
characteristics.description: Relevant prior medical and surgical history including comorbidities related to WD and other conditions (Section 7.1.3.3)

characteristics.name: Prior WD Therapies
characteristics.description: History of prior and ongoing therapies for Wilson Disease (e.g., penicillamine, trientine, zinc, prior ALXN1840), including duration >28 days vs ≤28 days used to define Cohort 1 (treatment-experienced) and Cohort 2 (treatment-naïve)

characteristics.name: Prior and Concomitant Medications/Therapies
characteristics.description: All prior and concomitant medications and therapies summarized by Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) class and preferred name, including those used to treat WD as noted in Section 7.1.4 and Appendix 9.2.7

characteristics.name: Baseline Laboratory Assessments
characteristics.description: Baseline clinical laboratory parameters (e.g., liver enzymes ALT, AST, GGT; INR; other safety labs) used to describe disease status and safety profile at baseline

characteristics.name: Baseline Vital Signs
characteristics.description: Vital signs at baseline (e.g., blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, body temperature), summarized per Section 7.3.3.2

characteristics.name: Baseline ECG Parameters
characteristics.description: Baseline electrocardiogram parameters (e.g., QT, QTc, QTcF) summarized per Section 7.3.3.4

characteristics.name: Cohort (Treatment-experienced vs Treatment-naïve)
characteristics.description: Cohort classification based on prior WD therapy exposure: Cohort 1 (treatment experienced, >28 days of WD therapy) vs Cohort 2 (treatment naïve, ≤28 days of WD therapy)
